TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Link extends System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl implements class System.Web.UI.IPostBackEventHandler

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")

Docs.summary: Represents a hyperlink to another on the same mobile page or to an arbitrary URI. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks On all devices, the link is rendered in such a way that the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A> property displays on the device to the user. When the user invokes the link, the browser navigates to the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Link.NavigateUrl%2A> property. The application must contain code that verifies that a link is browsable on a particular device. For example, the link http://www.microsoft.com is not browsable on a WML-capable device.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A> property is empty, the value in the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Link.NavigateUrl%2A> property is also used for the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A> property. Specifically, when the text writer renders a link, it first checks the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A> property for the text to display; if that property is empty, it displays the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Link.NavigateUrl%2A> property.
> [!NOTE] > If your application relies on cookieless sessions, or might receive requests from devices that require cookieless sessions, using a tilde ("~") in a path can inadvertently result in creating a new session and potentially losing session data. To set a property with a path such as ("~/path"), resolve the path using <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.ResolveUrl%2A>("~/path") before assigning it to the property.

Docs.permission: for operating in a hosted environment. Demand value: ; Permission value: .

Docs.param: The set of forms that contain links to the specified control.
Docs.summary: Adds the set of forms that contains links to the specified control to the provided list. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

Sets or returns the target URL of the link. The default value is an empty string (""). This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The target URL of the link.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the link to an image is unspecified (the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Link.NavigateUrl%2A> property contains an empty string ("")), the link will not be interactive.
If the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Link.NavigateUrl%2A> property begins with a number symbol (#), the remainder of the value is assumed to be the identifier of a form on the current <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage>. Otherwise, the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Link.NavigateUrl%2A> property is treated as a URL. When a link is rendered, the text writer writes the underlying <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A> property. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A> property is empty, the text writer writes the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Link.NavigateUrl%2A> property.
> [!NOTE] > If your application relies on cookieless sessions, or might receive requests from devices that require cookieless sessions, using a tilde ("~") in a path can inadvertently result in creating a new session and potentially losing session data. To set a property with a path such as ("~/path"), resolve the path using <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileControl.ResolveUrl%2A>("~/path") before assigning it to the property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance void RaisePostBackEvent(string argument) cil managed

Docs.summary: Raises events for the control when it posts back to the server. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

Sets or returns the text displayed for a softkey when the has a property defined. The default value is an empty string (""). This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The text displayed for a softkey when the has a property defined.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is used only for devices that support softkeys.
If this property is empty, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A> property of the control is used. If the underlying <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A> property is empty or its length is less than 9, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A> property is used for the softkey label. Otherwise, the word Link, or a localized equivalent, is displayed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Link> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackEventHandler> interface.
